results.name: a(n) = least k such that (k!*e^k)/(sqrt(2*Pi)*k^(k+1/2)) - 1 < 1/2^n.
comment: A proof would likely follow from applying Stirling's formula to k!. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 07 2014

a(n) is the least k such that the Stirling approximation to k! underestimates the real value by a factor of less than 1/2^k. The MathWorld link notes that replacing sqrt(2k) with sqrt(2k+1/3) in Stirling's approximation gives a much closer approximation of k!, which leads to the formula a(n) = ceiling(2^n/3). - _Charlie Neder_, Mar 06 2019
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, p. 18 (Stirling's formula).
link: Eric Weissstein's World of Mathematics, Stirling's Approximation.
